editorialNotes.standard: Wherever you are on your filmmaking journey, LumaFusion meets you there. This multitrack video editor offers pros the features rarely found in an iPad app, all accessible through an intuitive touch interface that even beginners can get the hang of.
editorialNotes.short: Apply transitions, effects and more with these powerful editing tools.

editorialNotes.standard: Pixelmator sets a new standard for photo editing on iPhone and iPad with a suite of staggeringly powerful tools. Combining gorgeous templates, intuitive touch-screen controls, and completely customizable effects, this full-featured editor is in a class all its own. Plus, with seamless syncing using iCloud Drive, it doesn’t matter where the project was started—you can keep editing on your iPhone, iPad, or Mac.
editorialNotes.short: Make your pictures shine with this professional set of photography tools.
A photo booth in your pocket.

editorialNotes.short: AirSnap’s remote control function makes sure no one has to ever be left out of a group photo.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: With Pixite’s incredible editor, you can add realistic 3D objects to your photos and videos, adjust everything from reflections to shadows in real time, and then share them across the internet. With a swath of impressive objects to place, a variety of sample backgrounds to test out, and the ability to animate your 3D models, Matter will make your photos and videos extraordinary.

The start of golden hour is no longer a guessing game thanks to Lumy. This simple but elegant tool helps maximize your time under the sun with tracking information for sunrise, solar noon, sunset, and so much more. It’s robust in the information it shares and has helped us prepare for photoshoots, plan outdoor adventures, and kept us in the loop across all our devices.
editorialNotes.short: Find the best time for taking the perfect shot

editorialNotes.standard: Shooting movies on film may be a dying art, but just because we live in the digital age doesn’t mean we have to abandon our analog past. We get warm, nostalgic fuzzies from 8mm Vintage Camera’s grainy, flickery film filters and lens effects, conjuring up memories of vacation travelogues screened in wood-paneled basements. It’s not just about old-school kicks, though—this powerful suite of tools can give any video an authentic period look.
editorialNotes.short: The easy way to create authentic vintage movies.
